Uses of Class
xxl.core.io.fat.errors.DirectoryException

  • Packages that use DirectoryException 
    Package Description
    xxl.core.io.fat
    This part is an implementation of the FAT12/16/32-filesystem based on raw access.
    xxl.core.io.fat.errors
    Contains errors for the fat implementation.

    • Uses of DirectoryException in xxl.core.io.fat

      Methods in xxl.core.io.fat that throw DirectoryException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void FATDevice.copyFileToOriginalFileSystem(String rawDirectoryName, File originalFile)
      This method can be used to exchange the data of a file from this file system based on raw-access to the original file system.
      void FATDevice.copyFileToRAW(File file, String directoryName)
      This method can be used to exchange the data of a file from the original file system to this file system based on raw-access.
      void DIR.createDirectory(String directoryName)
      Create a new directory (folder).
      void DIR.createDirectory(String directoryName, byte attributes)
      Create a new directory (folder).
      protected long FATDevice.createFile(String fileName)
      Create file and return the start cluster number.
      long DIR.createFile(String directoryName)
      Create a new entry in the directory.
      long DIR.createFile(String directoryName, byte attribute, long fileSize)
      Create a new entry in the directory.
      protected long FATDevice.createFile(String fileName, long length)
      Creates the file and return the start cluster number.
      long DIR.createFile(String directoryName, long fileSize)
      Create a new entry in the directory.
      protected List FATDevice.extendFileSize(String fileName, long numOfClusters)
      Extends the size of the file fileName with numOfClusters clusters.
      ExtendedRandomAccessFile FATDevice.getRandomAccessFile(String fileName, String mode)
      The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively.
      protected void DIR.setClusterNumber(String directoryName, long clusterNumber)
      Update the cluster number of the file given by directory name with the given cluster number.
      protected void DIR.writeDirectoryEntry(DirectoryEntryInformation dirEntInf)
      Write the directory entry of dirEntInf at the positions given by dirEntInf to disk.

      Constructor and Description

      Creates a random access file stream to read from, and optionally to write to, the file specified by the File argument.

    • Uses of DirectoryException in xxl.core.io.fat.errors

      Subclasses of DirectoryException in xxl.core.io.fat.errors 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FileDoesntExist
      Error class that is be thrown if the specified filename doesn't exist.
      class  IllegalName
      Error that is thrown in case the name of the file is illegal, that is, if it contains chars that are not allowed.
      class  InitializationException
      Error which will be thrown if something couldn't be initialized.
      class  NameAllreadyExists
      Error which will be thrown if there is already a file with this name in the same directory.
      class  NotEnoughMemory
      Error which will be thrown if there is not enough memory left.
